Smith & Wesson’s new M&P SHIELD™ is a slim, concealable, lightweight, striker-fired polymer pistol. Available in 9mm and .40 S&W, the new M&P SHIELD features a slim design combined with the proven and trusted features found in the M&P Pistol Series. From the pistol’s easily concealed one-inch profile to its optimized 18-degree grip angle, the M&P SHIELD offers professional-grade features that provide consumers with simple operation and reliable performance.

Chambered in 9mm and .40 S&W for proven stopping power, the M&P SHIELD features a high-strength polymer frame with a black, durable, corrosion resistant finish, coated stainless steel slide and barrel. Both models are standard with a 3.1-inch barrel, which contributes to an overall length of 6.1 inches and an unloaded weight of 19 ounces. For fast tracking and smooth target acquisition, the M&P SHIELD is standard with a 5.3-inch sight radius and has been enhanced with a short, consistent trigger pull measuring 6.5 pounds. Featuring a quick and audible reset made possible by the striker-fired action, the M&P SHIELD allows multiple rounds to be placed on target both consistently and accurately.

You can read the detailed specs at http://www.sigsauer.com/CatalogProductDetails/sig556r.aspx, but in brief, it has the famously reliable AK-47 action with an integrated optics top rail, sturdy side-folding stock, and takes standard double-stack AK47 magazines. Ambi safety. Birdcage flash-hider.

Comes with box and all the original accessories, including a 30-rd magazine, a Sig STS-081 mini red dot sight (in box with bikini cover, killflash, manual, and lens cleaning cloth; see http://www.amazon.com/SigTac-Mini-Red-Dot-Sight/dp/B001FT4S9E/ for further detail), fore-end rail pieces (for mounting a light, vertical foregrip), manual, etc.

Asking $1050 cash FTF. Firm. Putting this ad here first for local buyers, before offering at the online AK forums.

If you are looking for a lightweight, reliable, modern AK with AR ergos, don't miss this opportunity to pick one up locally with no taxes or shipping/transfer fees, as the 556R can be hard-to-find in stock. Whether you are a new owner and want a top-quality rifle for your first AK or a long-time collector looking to fill a hole in your AK collection, this rifle has something for you.

I live in Birmingham, but travel to Huntsville and Mobile regularly. I can provide proof (e.g. pistol permit) that I am a good guy and as many references as you need from recent firearms transactions. Deal with confidence. I won't waste your time, please don't waste mine.

title: For Sale:  Para Ordnance P12-45 Limited Race Gun 12 45 ACP
postcontent: Para Ordnance Model P12-45 Limited turned Race Gun. This pistol has been gone through & tricked out by a gunsmith and is worthy of competition use or as an ultimate carry gun. Basically a 1911 double stack with a 3 ½” barrel. It comes with three 12 round mags & a nice softcase to hold them all. The stainless steel barrel is ramped & has been jeweled in the area that passes the exhaust port. The stainless frame was blackened to match the slide. The ring hammer that has also been jeweled, extended beavertail, serrated mainspring housing, forward & rear slide serrations, topside slide serrations, 3 dot Novak sights in dovetails, lightweight aluminum trigger which is grooved & adjustable, reversible extended mag release & soft finger-grooved Hogue grips. The slide release & safety are as slick as can be, very user friendly piece. The pistol is in great shape, no damage just light handling marks & a little holster wear. Mechanically sound; functions better than new & the bore is excellent. This was recently acquired from the original owner whose best friend was the gunsmith that tricked it out. It has seen very little use & I think I have fired it more than he ever did. It is a pleasure to shoot & as accurate as any 5” barreled 1911 I have fired.

title: For Sale:  Aimpoint micro T1 t-1 red dot sight with Larue Tactical mount LT660
postcontent: Up for sale is a very nice Aimpoint micro T-1 red dot sight. It is 4 MOA and includes everything that came with it new. I purchased it, mount it on a rifle, used it only a handful of times, and then removed it before selling the rifle. Aimpoint accessories are all included: book, lens covers, original mount with screws, and adjustment tool included. The Aimpoint tool has a small chip on one side (used for opening the battery compartment) but the other side is perfect and only one side is needed. A coin works as well. This is authentic Aimpoint not a cheap knock off. The Larue Tactical is also the real deal. It is the more expensive and return to zero lever mount as opposed to the VFZ mount option.  I've included the Larue lever adjustment tool, spare screw, blue toctite, and Dillo (bottle opener). No cheap knock off stuff here boys and girls.  I own several of these setups and they are worth the coin. I did notice the serial number on the box and the sight don't match. Looks like I previously sold one of my other T1s and shipped the wrong box. Not a big deal just wanted to give full disclosure.

- Handgun, semi-auto

The Bushnell rifle scope is engineered with Amber-Bright optics that quickly help you distinguish between a brown tree and a brown critter, ideal for the autumn deer woods. With multi-coated optics for increased brightness in low-light conditions, the avid inner hunter in you will be most satisfied. No question about it, they're designed to excel during the day's most important times.

Protective case included. With high-density foam interior and two rifleshotgun carrying capacity Plano once again offers superior protection for your firearms.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Original Remington Model 1917-Excellent Condition-"American Enfield"
postcontent: This is an original Remington Model of 1917 in excellent condition.  This rifle was made in April of 1918, and used during WWI and possibly WWII.  It was rebarreled in 1944 by the US government.  The bore is bright and shinny and it shoots very well.  The 1917 was used by more of our soldiers in WWI than the Springfield M1903.  It was the model used by Sergeant York, the famous Medal of Honor winner of WWI.  The rifle is fantastic and all US arsenal original with the proper "flaming bomb" stamps.  Remington marked 1917s are twice as rare than the more common "Eddystone" 1917s.  You will not see many in this condition. Sling not included.   Feel free to call or text REDACTED or respond to this ad.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1944 Mosin Nagant M44 carbine Izhevsk round receiver 7.62x54R excellent condition no cosmoline sighted in very accurate
postcontent:
I have a very desirable and highly collectable Mosin Nagant M44 carbine. Made at the Izhevsk plant in 1944 these carbines are prized for their condition, accuracy, and the cool factor of the folding bayonet. This carbine has zero rust, excellent rifling, and has only been shot by one owner (me) about 100 times to sight it in. It has been recently expertly restored, there isn't a drop of cosmoline on it. All parts matching. Functions flawlessly, it has been sighted in to 100 yards via iron sights. Comes with sling and bayonet. NO RUST. The bore is bright, the lands and grooves look great, no pitting. Bolt works outstandingly, very crisp trigger and smooth bolt action, whole rifle in excellent condition. Bore is shiny and rifling great. Has not been counter bored. ALL PARTS ARE MATCHING.

TL;DR, this is a fantastic, POWERFUL rifle. These rifles are hard to find with Russian import bans, so get a great Mosin Nagant carbine!

I am also willing to sell as much surplus 7.62x54R ammo as you want with it at a reasonable price. Up to a crate. That's 880 rounds ready to go.

Why spend money on a modern hunting rifle, I.e. a bolt action in .308, 30-06, etc where the rifle costs 599 and the ammo is a dollar a round when you can have a Mosin Nagant for half the price and shoot all day with ammo that is ballistically identical to .308 but a third the price?!

I will consider shipping at a price.

Call or text 3 one 5 2 five six 3 six seven 4.

title: For Sale:  Smith and Wesson Model 1917 Brazilian
postcontent: This Smith & Wesson hand ejector model of 1917 serial number 187xxx was produced during the early part of the first contract for Brazil between number 181,983 and 207,043. They were first exported in 1938 when Brazil ordered 25,000 pistols and there were many more US 1917 models produced. The bore is excellent and has the original wood grips. There are no visible import marks but there may be one under the grips, which I have never removed. Some shooters prefer the Brazilian model because the rear sight has a squared off cross section, rather than an arched one like the US 1917, and has a better sight picture. It is chambered for the venerable 45 ACP cartridge utilizing moon clips. One can also fire it without clips as the cylinder has a shoulder for head space. Thank you for your interest. Cash Price $1100 Credit Price $1138

* An accessory rail (should you choose to add a flashlight and/or laser).

* An aggressively textured grips that aid in keeping the pistol in your hand.

* Restrike capability which allows you to pull the trigger a second time without the slide needed to be racked. This gives to option to attempt to fire a bullet for a second time if there was a light primer strike. 

* Has restrike capability. It normally operates as a conventional Single Action system e.g. every time the slide cycles it pre-cocks the firing pin. If an ammunition failure occurs and a misfire happens, the system automatically goes to a double action condition allowing you to fire again by pulling the trigger (double action), with no need to cycle the slide manually.

*  Disassembly/reassembly  is also extremely quick, easy, and does not require any tools or elbow grease. 

* 12 + 1 round capacity in a compact light 22 once frame.  The PT111 G2 is a double stack magazine that's similar in sight and weighs only 3 more ounces than the M&P Shield, but gives you 4-5 extra rounds compared to the Shield.  IMHO, excellent ergonomics are also excellent.

* Comes standard with magazine pinky extension which gives you a full 3 finger grip.

* Comes with a lifetime factory warranty. 

Manufacturer Information:

With its lightweight 22 oz. polymer frame, thin profile, and ramped 3.2 inch barrel, the newly designed Millennium G2 is the ideal concealed carry handgun. Available in two compact models—PT 111 and PT 140—the Millennium G2 features an accessory rail, high-profile sights, an aggressive, textured grip and melted edges for added comfort and easy concealment.

Model: 111G2	  
Caliber: 9 mm	 	 
Capacity: 12 +1	 
Weight: 22 oz.	 
Barrel Length: 3.2"	 
Frame: Compact	 
Action: SA/DA	 
Front Sight: Fixed	 
Length: 6.24"	 
Safety: Loaded Chamber Indicator,Manual Safety,Manual Safety,Taurus Security System,Trigger safety

title: For Sale:  H&K P2000 .40 S&W
postcontent:
Comes with original box, paper work, lock, and grips. This gun is slightly used and in excellent condition. 
The first of the many recent additions to the Heckler & Koch handgun line, the P2000 and incorporate features of the successful HK USP Compact pistol with the latest innovations of HK engineers. A refinement of a design created for several European police agencies, the P2000 is available with a traditional double-action/single-action trigger mode and the LEM/CDA (Law Enforcement Modification, also known as Combat Defense Action) trigger system first introduced in 2001 on the USP Compact “LEM” model.

The HK Law Enforcement Modification trigger system combines the advantages of a cocked striker component (constant level of trigger pull from first to last round fired) with a double-action hammer system.

Developed especially for a U.S. government agency, the Law Enforcement Modification (or LEM for short), is a unique trigger mechanism created specifically to improve the trigger performance and reduce the weight of the Double-Action Only (DAO) trigger pull on HK pistols.

With this mechanism, HK pistols can be fired like a standard DAO semi-automatic pistol where every round is fired by simply pulling the trigger fully rearward with the hammer starting at the forward rest position. The design of the proprietary HK LEM system allows the weight of the DAO trigger pull to be reduced to a smooth and constant 6.18 – 8.5 pounds (27.5 – 37.8 N) because the two-part hammer is pre-cocked every time the slide moves rearward. Trigger pull on conventional double action pistols is 12 – 15 pounds (53.4 – 66.7N).

The unique LEM pre-cocked hammer system combines the advantages of a cocked striker component (constant level of trigger pull and short trigger travel from first to last round fired) with a double action hammer system. Optional adjustment (by HK certified armorer) can bring the trigger pull into the 5.5 pound (24.5 N) range.

Using such an enhanced trigger system consolidates ease of use and safety into a convenient, innovative trigger operation — one that prevents unintended firing. And in case of an ammunition-related failure to fire, all that is needed is an additional second or third pull of the trigger without the need of first pulling the slide back to re-cock the P2000. The enhanced LEM trigger system combines the reliability of a double action revolver trigger with the crisp, precise trigger of a single action pistol.

A set of simple-to-install modular grip panels allow the P2000 to be custom-fitted to any shooter’s hand. An ambidextrous magazine release and dual slide release levers make handling the P2000 natural and easy for right and left-handed shooters alike.

Industry standard mounting rails allow the widest variety of lights, laser aimers, and accessories to be added to the P2000 by sliding them onto the open rail system. The HK P2000 includes the same recurved, hook trigger guard found on the USP Compact and uses reliable and widely available USP Compact magazines.

A limited edition P2000 German Police Model features a “closed” accessory mounting rail system and a tapered trigger guard.

Please contact SOWW ARMORY at REDACTED Monday-Friday 10:00-6:00 and Saturday 10:00-4:00
